messages.message:
PSA ala @lydia style, but without the cool infographics:
  TLDR; Let’s make sure that “make run-test-local” AND “make run-test-local USE_PY3=true” works!

   Making all of our unit and regression tests work with Python 3 prepares us for the gradual change we are making towards Python 3. The effort is currently not the top-top priority, so it’s a slow burn on our way to the Python 3 transition.

    Until we can get Python 3 and libraries installed on Jenkins and Travis @Chetan @Heymian @Karthik S — we can’t run these USE_PY3=true quite yet
Also remember to increase code coverage and write more unit-tests, especially since it’s Karthik’s birthday :slightly_smiling_face:
If mostly don’t know how to setup multiple virtual envs in a dockerfile and set it in each test. if someone wants to build that out, i can babysit the build and update it.
haha actually @will would you be interested it helping us build out this jenkins image to do ^. given that you’ve figured out how to do this in ansible, you might have the answer.
Yeah I would be glad to help. Do you need it today since it is Karthik’s birthday?
once there’s an image that can run py3 unit tests, travisc an incorporate easily
hahah no, don’t need it today, but this has been a huge gap in our test coverage. and i just haven’t had to time to figure out how to do this.
can jump on a call anytime to point you at some files. It should be pretty similar to what you did with your ansible script!
Is tomorrow ok? If not i can try for in a couple hours
yup for sure, tmr works great
